page.title: 02Farming N.E. of Longmynd
page.content: Farming is the main occupation in the area, some farms being privately owned others being smallholdings which are leased from the County Council.Some of the smallholdings are no longer run as farms but are owned by newcomers who use their land for grazing horses.Most fields are small with hedges as bound- aries.'Pick your own'fruit farming is a further use of land.Such farms specialise in selling soft fruits and vegetables direct to the public. The majority of the farms are prim- arily dairy farms but calf rearing plays an important role in the income of many farmers.Large farms also grow cereals for animal consumption.Those farms which include hill grazing rear sheep.Some grazing land is let.Sheep dogs for controlling livestock are kept on most farms.One farm special- ises in rearing pigs.
